name: Doubletree by Hilton Orlando at SeaWorld

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree at Seaworld for 4 nights, March 25-March 29. We were in town for the MegaCon comic book convention. We had a wonderful stay at the hotel, we were on the 14th floor in the tower. The beds were comfy and I loved the view of Sea World out the window. Everything was very clean and kept clean throughout our stay. We used our laptop in the lobby for free. It was nice to sit in there at the end of the day and watch all the important comic book writers and artists walk in and out. Since we checked in early we were given free breakfast vouchers. If we had to pay for the breakfast we would not have went with it being $17 per person. The other mornings we went to the Villiage Inn across the street. The Village Inn does have free wifi so you can bring your laptop and connect to the internet for free. We did get room service one night but it took over an hour to get our food. The woman at Room Service did call and let me know there was a mess up with our order and she did give us a discount for the mix up. I thought that was nice. We used the trolley to get to the convention and back and it was a nice ride. Everyone at the Front Desk was very nice when I had questions and when we checked in. A lot of the employees would greet us and say hello or good morning which I thought was a nice touch. My husband normally doesnt care where we stay but he really liked this hotel and wants to stay here again when we go back to Orlando. Thank you for a great stay!
reviews.title: An awesome 4 nights!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while in Orlando for a convention. The hotel lobby was very nice, but had a horrible smell, it was like they doused it with a "good smelling" fragrance to cover up a bad smell. It was overwhelming, and I was worried my room would have a similar smell. Luckily it didn't! The room was quite a walk away from the main hotel lobby, and I had a couple large bags, and lugged them up the stairs. I did later find out there was an elevator I could have used, but the front desk didn't help with that suggestion at all. They also didn't provide me with the internet code that was for our group complimentary, I finally got it out of them after having to call the front desk.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but did expect more for the money....
Good Hotel
reviews.text: Payed $40 for receiving charges for 2 shipments, that seemed a little absurd to me. The room was very nice, it had this cool wooden sliding device that seperated the bedroom from the bathroom. Only downside, I didn't have a bathtub which I could have really used to soak my feet in, and the shower area seemed dark and it was very small.

Ordered room service, and the food was ok, but the side salad I had was amazing. They did initially forget to bring it. I also went to the spa for a pedicure which was heavenly, and definitely worth the $90. ( I ordered reflexology with it as well.) The gal there who sits at the front desk was so nice, and so accommodating.
reviews.title: Nice hotel good base

reviews.text: I also visited the jacuzzi since I didn't have a tub to soak my sore feet in from the tradeshow, and that was surrounded my plush greens, and in a great area.
reviews.title: Superb
LAP TOP STOLEN, No response from security
reviews.text: I was staying at the hotel for a conference for 4 days. The day before my departure, my laptop was stolen out of my room. I called for security, to no response. After 30 mins I called the police and then the "emergency number" button on the phone in my room. The police arrived 5-10 mins later, and after the report was written up security came to my room and said absolutely nothing to me and didn't ask me any questions. I was told by the police officer that they had asked him for the information. Being totally freaked out that someone had been in my room, I was not about to stay another night, so I had a friend come pick me up. Upon check out I was told everything was taken care of and didn't receive a receipt, so naturally I thought they hadn't charged me for my stay. Well, I was wrong, I was charged for the full stay including the night that I didn't stay. Having heard nothing from security for a week, I made several calls to their security always getting an answering machine, and calls that were never returned. Concerned that there were no security cameras on site, and this horrible response from security I let my professional organization know what had happened, so they would choose a better hotel next time. In turn, they contact the hotel about the matter, in which they received a response from security, blaming me for the incident, insinuating that I was lying about when I told the police I was in my room!! I am soo shocked and horrified by this experience!! I have no idea what to do about it. I suppose I came out lucky that more things weren't stolen (I think I surprised the thief, as I wasn't at the pool long) It could have been much worse and I'm glad I wasn't in the room when it happened! I would still beware of staying at this hotel. There is no security cameras in the areas of the rooms, and no key required to get in the pool area. I am a very frequent traveller and I am always very safe about things, but this experience has totally left me affected in a negative way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 weeks in October. The lobby is lovely- still trying to recreate that smell of vanilla in our own home! Got to our room and were slightly disappointed with our room- it was facing the road- I didn't feel very safe- there were ants and the dead lock was broken. We called reception and got a new room which was inside facing and perfect! Easy walk to Seaworld and Aquatica- a godsend when I left the tickets in the room one day!!! The restaurant food was ok. Hairdryer in room. Maid service very good. Free shuttle to parks was brilliant!!! Village Inn is the place for breakfast... and PIE!!! Premium outlets is good at bottom but better at the top!
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: Overall we had such an amazing time and would be more than happy to stay at Doubletree at such a good price!!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - convenient location!

reviews.text: Spent 2 weeks at this hotel April 2011. Was perfect for our needs - close to Seaworld and Aquatica and a short drive to all the other parks. Just off one end of Int'l Drive which was great as it was quiet and no busy traffic sounds! Only 15 mins drive from the airport. Hotel was clean, pool was spotless, staff were extremely helpful and friendly - especially staff at the front door who were great for directions and advice. The grounds were immaculate and lots of things for kids to do e.g. outdoor giant chess, playground, ping pong, pool table, crazy golf and Suzy in the kids club was a big hit - even though we only spent 1 day at the pool!! She was great!! When we arrived we asked to change rooms and this was accommodated immediately. Moved to Block 6 right outside one of the pools - great for the kids aged 9 and 12. Only ate at the hotel once - had pizza from the Deli - nice pizza. We had breakfast every morning at the Village Inn across the street. It was great value and kept up going until dinner time! Hired a car and would recommend this as its very easy to get around and you don't have to depend on buses or trams. The I-trolley has a stop right outside the hotel door and this is great if you don't rent a car. While not the plushest hotel i've stayed in I would highy recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Orlando and do all the parks! Hotel has a large tower where I believe rooms are more up to date and more expensive but our room was perfect for our needs.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend staying here....superb pools and gardens, excellent food, friendly staff....and well positioned for seaworld and Aquatica....the best two parks in Orlando.
reviews.title: Brilliant - easily one of the nicest hotels in Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree as part of a two week break for our honeymoon. The reception wasn't very welcoming on arrival, and disappointingly despite it being our honeymoon and honours members we didn't get upgraded. The first room given to us was on a downstairs busy junction location so we asked to swop to an upstairs which was no problem to them. The rooms were nice, large bed and suite area, no fridge but the ice machine being nearby meant we could keep the sink stocked with the ac going so we could keep our drinks cool. The hotel had some good amenties, loads of pools to choose from, golf and laundry. We had a very nice meal in their restaurant one evening which wasn't too pricey. We found instead of going across to the Village every day for breakfast that the Max Deli sold bagels and fresh juice. You have to toast them yourselves using their toasters in the store but you got ample free butter and cream cheese and its cheapers and tip free. We used their shuttle to get to disney and universal. It wasn't very busy season which was great as the parcs were relatively queue free. The back gate leads to seaworld so you don't have to get the bus or I trolley, also you can get the 50 bus to disney from there also if you don't get the hotel shuttle - or come back by the 50 bus if you want longer there.
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms, but not special

reviews.text: All in all it was a very pleasant stay although not very special for a honeymoon. Would definately book there again as was very clean and good location. TIp :- you can ask anytime for cookie they readily gave them out - not just at booking in time which was nice.
reviews.title: Read this before you book!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a vacation package for this hotel through the Sea World web site. NO WHERE on the web site did it state that almost all the rooms have OUTSIDE entrances. Yes, they are on "resort" property however there is a lot of foot traffic in this area of Orlando and security wise it did not sit well with me. The room was listed as an "Interior Double". Meaning we had an upgraded Courtyard view...which was just grass. Although much better than the opposite side of the building that looked at dumpsters. I did call the front desk and asked for an upgrade to a Tower room-the only rooms that are all inside rooms. They upgraded us for an additional $10.00 a night. Not bad considering the room was almost twice the size of the previous room with an awesome view of Orlando. Also the shuttle they provide to Sea World is on a set schedule so you are rushing to catch it or have to wait. Also the knowledge of most of the staff was marginal. We also had tickets to the UCF football game but since it was pouring down rain opted to stay and watch it at the bar downstairs AFTER calling to confirm that they would be showing it. The bar is very attractive and the service okay, however they could not get the game on TV because they only have sateliite and do not get local channels. So we ate mostly unimpressive food while we waited for 45 minutes for the game to come on that they could not get. The concierge was no help either as he was completely unaware the hotel has DirecTV and not the local cable and did not offer to call or provide any numbers for local sports bar to see if they had the game. We ended up checking out early and forfeiting our 3rd free night. Most of this was due to the torrential downpour, however if the service had been better we would have just stayed. I will say the main property looked very nice and the pool areas were lovely. It also looked like they had a lot of activities that would have been fun if not for the hurricane like weather. When we checked out they did take the $30.00 upgrade fee off our bill. Bottom line, okay stay but get a Tower Room. Plan your events yourself and don't ask or expect much info from the staff and you will be okay. You can also take the walking path to SeaWorld and forego parking fees or waiting for their shuttle to show up.
reviews.title: a hidden oasis

reviews.text: Having stayed in Orlando in the "International Palms" (formally the holiday inn i think) up beside "Wet n Wild" the Doubletree was a really enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel.Would stay again

reviews.text: A light bulb went in our room and when we reported it we are thanked for reported the issue with warm cookies rather than made feel like you were being a annoyance.
reviews.title: Average Property

reviews.text: I planned our family vacation over six months ago, I was torn between the Hilton Grand Vacation or this property...I MADE THE RIGHT CHOICE!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.text: The staff is wonderful, starting with Joseph (who I bothered the week before we arrived, to ensure that he knew what type of room we wanted). Joseph made sure that we had the perfect room for us girls (my daughters and I). The breakfast is superb, and has everything under the FL sun for breakfast. The staff are all polite and very kind, Elitha in housekeeping brighted the day with her beautiful smile as she worked. Security does a good job of making sure that safety is assured. This is just a beautiful resort with a great staff, do NOT hesitate to make reservations here! Thank you Doubletree SeaWorld we had a great time and miss your paradise!!!! TR
reviews.title: lovely but a bit out of the way

reviews.text: Booked 12 nights in the doubletree for our honeymoon.even though we booked it as a honeymoon via tour america i dont think they believed us as my 10 year old son was with us.certainly there were no added perks you would expect having spent a couple of thousand on a honeymoon!check in was quick and efficiant despite hotel being really busy.we were offered a choice of a resort room or a room in the tower.always go for the tower if you get the choice. room was good size on the 14th floor.nice view.tip-leave a couple of dollars on the pillow for the chambermaid.we didnt know this was the done thing but once we found out the room was spotless with a complimentary paper every day! pool was fab,especially at 6am when the sun is rising.its lovely at night time too and is heated.only ate in hotel once on the first evening. had breakfast a few mornings in the village in.its nice..but if you are sitting in trish's section prepare to have your ears burned off! my god she can talk!!
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here If You Are On Business - Decent for Tourists

reviews.text: good size tv in room,nice tolitries in room.drink prices at the bar are high so we got beers etc at the huge walmart on turkey lake road and drank by the pool.
reviews.title: superb man

reviews.text: There is a couple of restaurants across the road but hotel is not in the heart of international drive and you cant walk to it.The i ride trolloy does not go to universal so we got a taxi to and from one night (we had car but wanted a few drinks during mardi gras)
reviews.title: It's close to Sea World. Period.

reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks at Doubletree and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed (iron,microwave,coffee machine,fridge,safe etc). The staff were helpful and friendly and never failed to greet us and wish us a nice day. We made use of most of the amenities at the hotel including room service and the launderette which was very useful with 2 children and would definitely recommend the restaurant for excellent food at a reasonable price. The 3 pools were all lovely and clean and luckily our room was situated right by one pool with a poolside bar open during the day. The breakfast buffet was amazing, the best breakfast we had during our stay and the deli was very convenient for bagels and cereals etc perfect for breakfast on the go. The location of the hotel is great, about 15 min drive to Disney, walking distance to Seaworld and Aquatica and the hotel provide a free shuttle to Disney. I would definitely recommend this hotel, it is the best hotel we've ever stayed in and will definitely stay again next time we visit Florida.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: The first impression of the lobby and overall look of the hotel is wonderful. The staff was very polite and helpful. The first hmmmm moment was when they charged us an extra $15.00 for parking. We travel all the time, once a month or more, and unless it is a downtown hotel, this was curious to us. After driving through the private gate to the parking and rooms we saw that parking was very limited and we were not able to park near the door of our room. The security of the gate was nice, but the connivence of parking near our room was not an option.
reviews.title: First impression great-things that really matter poor.

reviews.text: In entering the room, my detailed antenna when up again. The carpet had stains and there was a very unpleasant mold smell. We found this disappointing due to the fact that the hotel is higher rated than this standard showed. The under standard conditions continued inside the room. There were dark stains and more than one hair in the tub!!! This was unsettling. The problems continued. My husband had to get up after we tried to go to sleep to jiggle the toilet handle to get it to stop running. There were stains on the coverlet they lay at the end of the bed. The drainage in the shower was very poor. I hate standing in water over my feet in the shower that does not drain.... The unclean, mildew smell was stronger in the bathroom also.
reviews.title: Good Bit Out

reviews.text: We did share all these concerns with the management the next day as we checked out and he was very helpful and wanted to give us a free room. We declined, we were not after a free anything, just disappointed and for the price of the room, we knew the standards should be much higher. This could be a very delightful hotel in every area, details just need to be taken care of. Cleanliness and mechanical issues should be priority over the "wow" factor in lobby. We have stayed at other Double Trees, one of them was by MCO, and had wonderful experiences. We just hope this one can pay attention and get all the details up to standard.
reviews.title: Nice pools, but not-so-nice beds and front desk staff

reviews.text: Hotel stay was ok. Reception very nice and clean. Staff were friendly and polite. Nice warm cookie on arrival. Room was nice and had everything you would need. Hotel right beside seaworld and you can easily walk to enterance of the park. If you are looking to get to the rest of Flordias attractions and are not renting a car then this is not the place to stay. Hotel is a good bit out from the main attractions and right at the top of international drive. Shopping malls again good bit out from hotel. I trolly does service hotel but driving yourself is much better. One thing you are not informed about is that you have to pay for car parking at the hotel each day. Works out at about $6 a day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff at the Doubletree Hilton Seaworld

reviews.text: Stayed at the Doubletree Resort from September - October 10th and very impressed. Our room was on the 11th floor in the tower and room was spotless. Our maid cleaned our rooms to a very high standard daily. The grounds of the hotel were beautifully maintained. We didn't eat at the restuarant (Bamboo Grille) as we found the meals quite expensive, but instead went across the road to eat at the Village Inn which offered a 10% discount if you stayed at the Doubletree. The hotel shuttle which goes to and from the most popular parks were very good but be prepared for a long(er) journey as the bus also picks up and drop off from other hotels. The hotel is also well served by the iRide Trolley stop and Lynx Bus stops directly outside the hotel which is handy for trips along International Drive and beyond. The only downside was our arrival at check-in. Due to a long flight delay we arrived at the hotel very late after midnight and the check-in lady was a little irritated(!) when we didn't produce the document needed to check in fast enough! Okay we were tired too (a 5 hour delay and an 8 hour flight can take it out of you!) but we did feel it wasn't the most warmest of welcomes after travelling for so long to get there. However, the lovely cookies did compensate for that and we were happy to finally get into our room to crash out. Would we stay again? Yes definitely!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree for two weeks and enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a Pure Room and it was a big room with a very comfortable bed and was very quiet. This was arranged by April Willis and she was great to contact via email before we arrived and went out of her way to make our stay comfortable. It was in block 8 at the back towards Sea World, this suited us as it was by the car park and so was convenient for going out each day, we weren't bothered about a garden or pool view. We ate at the Bamboo Grill one night and the food was lovely and not too expensive. Our server was Chris and he was very helpful and pleasant. We went to Village Inn across the road as it was convenient but I have reviewed that separately as we weren't happy with them at all.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Didn't have any problems with anything at Doubletree and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Really great hotel (and you can walk to Sea World)

reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location when you're going to Sea World. There is a walk-way from the hotel, with Sea World being about a 10 minute walk. You save $14 on parking by walking. The hotel and staff are wonderful. Every staff member is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and fresh. The hotel has at least 3 pools and is VERY kid and pet friendly. The breakfast buffet is awesome! My family and I (including our dog) have stayed at this location twice now in 2011.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a quiet location

reviews.text: If you are heading to Disney or Universal Studios, the hotel is centrally located to both. Very easy to get to either theme park from this Doubletree.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled for our anniversary, I emailed the hotel before we arrived and arranged an upgrade etc as a supprise for my wife, when we arrived they had upgraded us from that room as well to a very large corner suite with champagne, chocolates and sweets. It was really lovely. Checking in was quick and easy as was checking out.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was exstremely good. The outdoor pools all heated to a very comfortable temperature and open until midnight each day with towels supplied. Also a very good fitness centre open 24 hours a day!
reviews.title: Don't expect the Hilton quality beds here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were friendly and helpful form cleaners to servers to managers.
reviews.title: Don't be put off by all the negative reviews.

reviews.text: Hotel Taxi's are on hand outside the hotel, we arranged to go to a show and the driver rang the venue and got all the finishing times etc and met us as we came out and returned us to the hotel with no waiting outside. Highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Nice, clean, comfortable hotel
Honeymoon in Florida
reviews.text: Good location. Property and grounds are nice, but beds are very uncomfortable. I chose this hotel because of the Hilton name and expected the Hilton quality beds and bedding, but the beds were stiff and damp feeling. The rooms are not sound proof, I felt like I could hear every outside noise like it was in my room, from people talking to carts rolling down the sidewalk. The decor was fine and fairly clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights in October and got a great deal pre-booking 10 months in advance using 'Lowcostholidays'.
reviews.title: Good stay at the Doubletree

reviews.text: We were allocated a room in block 17 facing the gardens. The room was large and nicely appointed, with two small double beds. The wardrobe was adequate for 2 people, but might be a struggle for more occupants in one room, however there was a large chest of drawers.
reviews.title: Started badly but got better

reviews.text: The room is quite dark and we had to turn on lamps during the day, but this was fine. I really like a dark room at night, so this worked out well. A fridge in the room would have been really welcome.
reviews.title: Always return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The block was also quiet. Housekeeping was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The bathroom was small, really small. However outside was a vanity and sink area, which was huge! This section could be screened off using a sliding door. This set-up afforded little privacy though.
reviews.title: double delight and doubletree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the Doubletree by Hilton Orlando at SeaWorld. We stayed in block 14 garden view which was quiet. We chose this hotel primarily for it’s location, other good reviews and that I hold a Hilton Honors Gold card.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good
reviews.title: Good

reviews.text: 1. Great hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great hotel.....would stay again

reviews.text: 2. Friendly staff.
reviews.title: About as good as expected for business, considering it is geared for tourists

reviews.text: 3. Walking distance to Seaworld (don’t forget to ask for the free quick queue unlimited at the Expedia office).
reviews.title: Outstanding for its category

reviews.text: Clean, stylish rooms, and great facilities. Pool, pool tables, hot tub, restaurant, business center, all great! I had a slight problem with my room key at first (wouldn't work) but it was quickly replaced by staff and was fine for the rest of my stay. I stayed 3 days and had a terrific time. There is an Expedia office there that helps you with day travels, shopping tips, trolley tickets, and more-they were really helpful.
reviews.title: Double Tree-Double your pleasure! :)

reviews.text: We recently stayed in this hotel and were very impressed overall. The check in process was quick and easy, staff very friendly and a delicious warm cookie on arrival is always good. Our room was in block 10 on the third floor and was overlooking the pool. The room was spacious, clean and well decorated with 2 extremely comfy double beds and a nice shower. Personally would've preferred a bath with a showerhead but it was sufficient. We had the buffet breakfast at the hotel one morning and although the price may appear steep, the content was delicious and there was a very large choice of items. The hotel provided shuttles to the main theme parks which were convenient and on days when we did not use them taxis were not too expensive,, 20-30 dollars (including tips). We used the I-ride a couple of times which provided access to international drive and there was a stop directly outside our hotel. As for the hotel facilities, we didn't really use them, however one evening we did usedthe pool which was very nice. We were made aware of several events going on in the hotel throughout our stay. Also the staff on reception were always happy to give us a cookie on request! All in all an excellent stay and would definitely consider staying again. :)
reviews.title: Great hotel! :)

reviews.text: Only two positive things to say about this hotel: it is within walking distance of the convention center and the pools are pretty. Other than that, it was a very bad experience. Check in was tedious and the front desk staff is not very competent. I had to change my key several times during my stay. The room was dated and moldy. The grout in the shower was black and you could actually see mold spores. Breakfast at the restaurant, with beverage, came to about $20; if you do take a chance and stay here go across the street to the Village Inn where you can get a four item breakfast for $7. Parking is a real problem here--supposedly the hotel was sold out but parking in front of your room is unlikely and it is $10 a day. Besides not cleaning the hotel rooms well, the housekeeping staff is apparently eager to go home--after getting breakfast in the morning on the day of checkout I got back to the room and found all of my stuff was gone-- the housekeeping staff thought that I had checked out and I had to retrieve it from security. Several food items were not returned. Three days later I am still feeling sick from the moldy room. I am a frequent business traveler and this is one of the worst places I have ever stayed. A disgrace to the Hilton chain!
reviews.title: A Very Bad Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am writing a review to express my gratitude towards this hotel. This hotel is the host hotel for GayDays, an annual Orlando event. DoubleTree reserves the entire hotel and it’s on heck of an event. We attended in 2011 & 2012. The hotel itself is a great place to stay, and the staff were all friendly towards all of the gay guest this week. A+++++ to the hotel management for such a great accomplishment. This event the hotel sell out, has pool parties all day-at any time I would guess there are 1,000’s of people on the grounds, and the staff does a great job with it. Because of this hotels friendliness towards the GBLT community when we travel, we always make sure we stay at a Hilton property. Keep up the great work – and we can’t wait to come back in May!!!
reviews.title: A++++

reviews.text: I was deeply disappointed with the standard of this Hilton hotel I have to say. I always stay at Hilton Hotels when I go away. This was the only Hilton hotel were i would have second thoughts about staying there again. Firstly on arrival we were promptly allocated a double twin room rm number 1030. When we used the shower within our room the shower tray wasn't draining and was over flowing over tray. I reported this to reception desk and this was fixed promptly i have to say. Then we were invaded from the start with sugar ants that were crawling all over washroom and taps and within bedroom area. I promptly reported this to a male member of staff on main reception who was disinterested and stated he would send an engineer to have a look. The engineer arrived within the hour and said the guest prior to us must have brought them (sugar ants) into the room through their lugguage. He briefly sprayed lightly in wash room to remove ants. I am asthmatic and couldnt tolerate the smell of spray throughout room. Two days later ants just kept getting worse in room and i had spoken to a different male member of reception staff and yet again no appology for inconvience caused and unhelpfull member of staff. I couldn't sleep well for the whole 10 nights we stayed within the Doubletree due to the ants within room area. I feel prior to our arrival the cleaning staff preparing the room for our arrival would have seen the large amount of ants crawling around the room and should have had the room treated properly prior to guests being allocated rm 1030. On depature i checked out at reception and a young female member of staff asked how we enjoted our stay and i explained my experience with reception staff when i reported i was unhappy with my room and this was quickly dismissed by them. Female member of reception staff who did deal with my checkout was very polite and stated she was sorry to hear of my feedback and offered us both complimentary breakfast which we both declined as we were checking out and had airport transport arranged. Reception staff should have dealt with my concerns prior to my departure and should have moved us rooms instead of dismissing me at reception when reporting my concerns regarding the condition of our room. We paid good money to stay at this hotel and we are very disappointed at the standard of the room allocated. I have never experienced anything like this at any other Hilton hotel we have stayed at. Very dissapointing customer care.
reviews.title: Recent trip to Doubletree

reviews.text: Hotel clean pity about the pool - during our stay myself and
reviews.title: Human poo in the pool !!!!

reviews.text: and my daughter swam in the pool for approx 40 mins only to find put we had been swimming in a pool with human excrement in ! I was obviously very distressed and upset about this and repoted it to reception who didnt apologise i asked them to note our names incase we became ill they sent a security officer to file a report .The officer told me the report would be shown to the hotel manager - i still did not hear anything so wrote a letter to the manager for feedback but didnt get any !!!! Judge for yourself ...
reviews.title: wonderful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: everything about this hotel was wonderful. Staff was helpful and courteous. No issues whatsoever! Thank you
reviews.title: A GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: Me and my new fiancee stayed here for 2 weeks for my 21st birthday, on arrival we checked in very quickly and wne to our room which was in block 9 number 926. when we walked in the room we were very impressed with the huge bed, nice set up and fridge ect, everythin u would need for a florida holiday. The room was cleaned daily to a very high standard. The hotel is at the bottm end on i drive and i do believe the i trolley is the way to get round i drive very quick and cheap, we didnt hire a car and managed fine. The transferes to the parks were a weeny bit long winded but for free what more can u ask for however if u are taking kids have a drink and ds to keep the kids entertained. Seaworld is literally a 5 min walk away out of the back gate wich is fab, and also look on disneys website before you go to see when and what time shows are on so you dont miss them. The hotel staff were always smiling and happy to help. The on sight pizza hut is a god send when your back from the parks late and cant be bothered getting ready for a meal. If we were every lucky enough to go back to floria we wouldnt stay anywere else this hotel really does have it all for a florida holiday and if you are reading this becuase your going soon i am very very Jealouse !!!!!
reviews.title: Like Airlines-expect loads of added costs!

reviews.text: Fees for everything! Parking, wi-fi in rooms, small fridge if you are insulin dependent, etc. The rooms are fabricated to be more modern but don't be fooled. The wood is painted chipboard and the bathroom door touches the shower door when open. Four foot wide desk with a single chair AND no other table/chair. As a business traveler, no wi-fi in the conference is unacceptable. There is free wi-fi in the lobby but so slow. Oh - and in the middle of rain(when we arrived) there were numerous roof leaks in lobby and conference center. Overall the place gets a 2 on a scale of 1-5. To be more cost effective AND efficient, the simplest way is to create the future consumer. Our kids will remember their parents complaints(and they are tech savvy with their own I-phones & pads).
reviews.title: Not Bad but Nothing to Write Home About

reviews.text: Me and my husband got married in Florida 2010 and loved the hotel and it's layout, fab customer service and decided to go back last year in May 2012 with our 4 year old little girl.
reviews.title: Love it but just wish....

reviews.text: Well as i remember the rooms were fab in 2010 and they were just exactly the same 2012, spotless!!!! Greeted at reception with a warm cookie and a helpful member of staff.
reviews.title: Greetings from Quito Ecuador

reviews.text: The newspaper on the door every morning was a lovely added touch our stay.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were alittle disheartened when the kids club they had in 2010 was no longer in use, with no reason as to why. wasn't too bad as we had plenty of day outs planned but....when we didn't my little girl wanted to use the swimming pool.
reviews.title: Dissapointed!

reviews.text: The last weekend of our stay they had a gay event! which i wouldn't minded if we had been told upon our arrival that this was going to be happening. Two of the swimming pools at certain times were blocked off due to the event and with having a 4 year old little girl who loves to swim it was so upsetting for her not to be able to swim when the events around the pool were on. I just wish were told by a member of staff on our arrival. As it put us on a bit of a downer on the last few days when our little girl wanted to swim.
reviews.title: nice gardens

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Orlando At Seaworld Hotel Orlando
description: The new Doubletree by Hilton Orlando at Seaworld, formerly the Doubletree Resort Orlando – International Drive, has been transformed by its recent $35 million makeover to a warm and tranquil travel oasis redefining the meeting and vacation experience. Conveniently located adjacent to SeaWorld and its water park Aquatica and just minutes away from Universal Orlando Resort, Walt Disney World and the Orange County Convention Center.
